results.title: The Lawnmower man
results.creator_credit: Brett Leonard, Gimel Everett, Fuji Eight, Lane Pringle Productions, Allied Vision and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A brilliant scientist, obsessed with perfecting a revolutionary virtual reality software program, enlists the aid of a slow-witted gardener, only to encounter a shadowy group seeking to turn the “lawnmower man” into the ultimate weapon. Stars Pierce Brosnan with Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Mark Bringleson, Geoffrey Lewis.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

results.title: Grosse Pointe blank
results.creator_credit: George Armitage, Donna Roth, Roger Birnbaum, Susan Arnold and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Hilariously black romantic comedy about a hit man who returns to his home town and attends his high school reunion. Encountering a former flame, who he unceremoniously jilted several years earlier, Martin is caught between his dark past (that has followed him home) and his desire for something new with Debbie. Top cast includes John and Joan Cusack, Alarn Arkin, Minnie Driver and Dan Ackroyd.

results.title: Cop land
results.creator_credit: James Mangold, Ezra Swerdlow, Cathy Konrad, Gary Woods, Miramax Films and Woods Entertainment
results.brief_description: Freddy Heflin is a simple, small-town sheriff whose life is about to change. After he uncovers evidence of murder, faked suicide and police tampering, Freddy must choose between the man he idolizes, the woman he adores and the law he’s sworn to defend. Cast includes Sylvester Stallone, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Robert de Niro.

results.title: Pink Floyd: Pulse
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Lana Topham, Pink Floyd (1987) Ltd and Picture Music International (PMI)
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Earls Court, London on October 20th, 1994. This is classic Pink Floyd performing some of their best known music including “Learning to fly”, “Another brick in the wall”, “Money”, “Us and them”, and “Comfortably numb”. Features David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Richard Wright with Sam Brown, Claudia Fontaine, Durga McBroom on backing vocals, Jon Carin on keyboard and vocals, Dick Parry on saxophone, Tim Renwick on guitars and vocals and Gary Wallis on percussion.

results.title: Mission: impossible 2
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Paula Wagner, Tom Cruise, Wagner Production and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Visually charged action-packed sequel to the 1996 original, “Mission Impossible 2”, directed by John Woo, has all the kinetic thrills expected from a master of the genre, but a simplified script leaves it strangely lacking in tension. Tom Cruise reprises his role as Ethan Hunt, the daredevil spy, who falls for a former flame of a spy turned bad. Hunt must rescue his new love, and save the world from a deadly virus. Supporting cast includes Thandie Newton (as the love interest) and Dougray Scott (as the villain).

results.title: To Live and die in L.A.
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Irving H. Levin, SLM and New Century
results.brief_description: This action packed movie centres around two LA cops, one who eventually gets killed in the line of duty and the other who seeks his partner’s revenge. Stars William L. Petersen, Willem Dafoe, John Pankow, Debra Feuer, John Turturro, Dean Stockwell and Robert Downey Snr. Based on the novel by Gerald Petievich.

results.title: Reflections in a golden eye
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Ray Stark and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An edgy drama based on a novel by Carson McCullers this feature focuses on complicated relationships. The story is set on a Southern American Army Base in 1948 and is a complex web of sexual repression, military discipline and extra-marital affairs. Major Penderton (Marlon Brando) hides his homosexual tendencies behind strict discipline while his frustrated wife (Elizabeth Taylor) has an affair with a Lt. Colonel (Brian Keith). To make things more complicated the Lt. Colonel’s wife is also having an affair with her houseboy. Then there is Private Williams (Robert Foster) who likes naked horse riding. The repressed and obsessive Major Penderton has strong feelings of mixed jealousy when the young Private shows interest in his wife rather than him. This story of bad marriages and military life is both bleak and obsessive. The characters are living in a self imposed prison which they can not escape. This is a tense and compelling drama although criticized for its average screenplay.

results.title: Sally of the sawdust
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on a stage play “Sally of the Sawdust” features the first screen appearance of W.C. Fields and is a silent romantic comedy directed by the great D.W. Griffith. The drama starts in a circus during the Twenties and introduces the story of an orphan Sally (Carol Dempster) and her loveable, juggler, circus performing carer Prof. Eustace P. McGarcle (Fields). Sally is initially unaware that McGargle is not her real father who, through the course of events, decides to reunite her with her grandparents. They make a comedic journey to the town of her grandparents where a wealthy man falls for the circus girl and the drama unfolds. It is a story of mistaken identity, romance and family reunions. The film is known more for being W.C. Fields first screen appearance than one of D.W. Griffith’s greats although it has all the hallmarks of his film genius. It is an entertaining and visually exciting silent melodrama. This version has a music score added. Cast includes Alfred Lunt a theatre actor making a rare screen appearance.

results.title: The Stunt man
results.creator_credit: Richard Rush and Melvin Simon Productions
results.brief_description: A mysterious fugitive escapes from the law and ends up becoming a stunt man under a mesmerizing, possibly insane movie director (Peter O’Toole). Explores the ever changing nature of reality and illusion. Cast also includes Steve Railsback, Barbara Hershey.

results.title: Loot
results.creator_credit: Silvio Narizzano, Arthur Lewis and Performing Arts
results.brief_description: After a bank heist, the Inspector is called upon to investigate the suspects: a gold-digging nurse, a widower, and a dead body. When the criminals are discovered, a chase ensues, and an arrest is made. Cast includes Richard Attenborough, Lee Remick, Hywel Bennett, Milo O’Shea, Dick Emery, Joe Lynch, Aubrey Woods. Based on the play by Joe Orton.
